snippet: GARRETT--Elizabeth. The Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and American Technion Society (ATS) communities are saddened by the passing of Cornell University President Elizabeth Garrett. In the ongoing partnership between the Technion and Cornell University to build an applied sciences campus on Roosevelt Island, Mrs. Garrett was a true and steadfast partner, whose clear vision, great wisdom and boundless energy will be greatly missed. To her husband, Professor Andrei Marmor, and the rest of the Marmor and Garrett families, we extend our heartfelt condolences. Lawrence Jackier, Chairman, Technion Board of Governors Peretz Lavie, President, Technion-Israel Institute of Technology Zahava Bar-Nir, President, American Technion Society Jeff Richard, Executive Vice President, American Technion Society 1/3
lead_paragraph: GARRETT--Elizabeth. The Technion-Israel Institute of Technology and American Technion Society (ATS) communities are saddened by the passing of Cornell University President Elizabeth Garrett. In the ongoing partnership between the Technion and Cornell University to build an applied sciences campus on Roosevelt Island, Mrs. Garrett was a true and steadfast partner, whose clear vision, great wisdom and boundless energy will be greatly missed. To her husband, Professor Andrei Marmor, and the rest of the Marmor and Garrett families, we extend our heartfelt condolences. Lawrence Jackier, Chairman, Technion Board of Governors Peretz Lavie, President, Technion-Israel Institute of Technology Zahava Bar-Nir, President, American Technion Society Jeff Richard, Executive Vice President, American Technion Society 1/3
